title: Apple's Trying To Make 'Slofie' A Thing, Internet Says Nope
text:
A lot of things were announced by Apple today but one of them really stood out. Apple, in a classic weird uncle move, is trying to convince the youth they need slow-mo selfies, or slofies, in their life. The internet gave it a piece of its mind – though to be clear, a hands on might change everything.

Everything Apple Announced Today Every year it feels like Apple’s big iPhone event offers fewer and fewer surprises. This year was no different. Once again, we got three new phones and a new Apple Watch. But we also got some new and interesting details about the company’s future. Read more

The iPhone 11 series was unveiled by Apple today and we now have a better idea of what to expect from the upcoming devices. They'll now come with a new mode for the selfie cam allowing you to slow everything way down. It's also invented a new word to go with it; the 'slofie'.

New slow motion feature available on the front camera... and a new word #Slofies #iPhone11 #AppleEvent pic.twitter.com/8Jqx4YB2DA — Francisco Jeronimo (@fjeronimo) September 10, 2019

Apple's site reckons it'll record in 120 frames per second on it's 12-megapixel front-facing camera so you can look like a professional model when it all slows down.

"Everything looks cooler at 120 fps, even if you're just saying 'cheese', waving hello or tossing your hair in the breeze. And now you can add more of everything to your selfies thanks to the new 12‑megapixel TrueDepth camera. Just turn your iPhone to landscape and the camera automatically zooms out to fit more in," Apple's site read.

So, for the minimum price of $1199, you too can have a chance to capture your face in slow-mo. RIP to all the parents out there having to listen to deny their children's well-worded arguments for an expensive birthday present.

The internet's reaction was understandably savage.

That moment when you watched 2 hours of the #AppleEvent only to learn about #slofies ????????‍♀️ pic.twitter.com/Ma30EPSfG7 — Jaime Donally (@JaimeDonally) September 10, 2019

Instagram is about to explode with #slofies until all of 2020 in 5, 4, 3, 2.... pic.twitter.com/AeiCNeOto2 — Danny Dimes Jones (@GeezyRunThis) September 10, 2019

Apple just coined the term #Slowfie, for a slow-motion selfie taken with the new iPhone 11 front-facing camera. Word of the year. — Henry Faber (@henryfaber) September 10, 2019

2020: ‘So what do you do for a living again?’ ‘I’m a Slofie creator.’ Calling it right, damn, now. ???????? #AppleEvent #Slofies https://t.co/1Cick3Mwss — Ali Aljoubory (@AliAljoubory) September 10, 2019

#slofies Some of y'all already move slow enough WITHOUT the Slow motion feature. Just saying. pic.twitter.com/QeNvh6pRpb — valerie (@Valthehbic) September 10, 2019

Apple calling Slo-Motion Selfies...wait for it...”Slofies”. Stop trying to make “Slofies” happen. ???????????? #AppleEvent pic.twitter.com/qUJCUN2siy — Brian Tong (@briantong) September 10, 2019

Guys gather around, let’s take a “SLOFIE” - Kids 2020 ???? #AppleEvent — Safwan AhmedMia (@SuperSaf) September 10, 2019

Elsie is ready for her first #slofie, which also qualifies as a #slothie. pic.twitter.com/R0IRMdg3p3 — Brookfield Zoo (@brookfield_zoo) September 10, 2019

Let's hope 2019 doesn't turn into the Year of the Slofie. We've had a tough one already.
